title: IPMEP 127 and 738

Similarly, the Apocalypse copy closest to the St John’s MS, Harley 3913 (see Apoc xxi), prefaces the text with three prologues, rather than the customary one. The first two unique passages have been derived from portions of the Lollard Psalter commentary (an identification for which I am grateful to Anne Hudson) and the whole bound with a Lollard theological notebook
MMBL 3, 404; Ker reports the note as having been added on a flyleaf somewhat later, ’s
